p: Following anesthesia by intraperitoneal injection of 10% chloral hydrate (0.3 mg/kg), the abdominal aorta was occluded below the bifurcation of the left renal artery to induce ischemia at the lumbar segment of the spinal cord. At the designated time points, the vascular clamp was closed or open. Under anesthesia, lumbar segments of the spinal cord were taken and immediately frozen at −70°C in liquid nitrogen[ 1].
